val:
Today I was setting up an automated build using TeamCity and came across an issue where the build of the solution kept failing. Â The only reason that was given was this:

[MSBuild output] CSC : fatal error CS2008: No inputs specified

Turns out that MSBuild actually fails the whole build when youâ€™re running it from the command line like this if thereâ€™s not a file that it can build. Â The project in question was actually just full of XML and configuration files that other projects referenced and got published with a NuGet package to our private feed. Â To fix it, I just added a simple .cs file, so that MSBuild had something to do. Â ğŸ™‚

Hereâ€™s the code:

[syntax type=â€œhtml|php|js|cssâ€]

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Linq;
using System.Text;

namespace Configuration
{
class MSBuildBugFix
{
// MSBuild has a bug where if no source files are found, the build fails when
// running from the commandline (or in our case, TeamCity). This file is only here
// to allow the build to complete.
}
}

[/syntax]
